# finding the objective function
obj <- x(420, 360, 300, 420, 360, 300, 420, 360, 300)

# constraints
mat <- matrix(c(1, 1, 1, 20, 15, 12, 1, 1, 1), nrow = 6, ncol = 3)
dir <- x("<=", "<=", "<=", "<=", "<=", "<=")
rhs <- x(750, 900, 450, 13000, 12000, 5000, 900, 1200, 750)

# Create the linear programming model
mod <- lp(direction = "max", obj, mat, dir, rhs)

# Add the equal percentage of excess capacity constraint
const <- x(1, 1, 1)
eq <- "="
rhs <- x(1)
mod <- addConstraint(mod, const, eq, rhs)

# Solve the linear programming model
sol <- solve.LP(mod)

# Print the solution
print(sol)
